lists-operations_key1: # Lists ke saath kya kar sakte hain?
lists-operations_key2: Iss exercise mei hum samjhenge ki `LISTS` ko kaise use karte hai. Jaisa humne dekha `LIST` mei kaafi values hoti hai. Toh hume koi tareeka chahiye jisse hum in values ko access kar paye.
lists-operations_key3: `[1]` likhne karne se kya hua? "shivam" print hua?
lists-operations_key4: Yaha par 1 ko `INDEX` bolte hai. Kisi item ko access karne ke liye uska INDEX daalte hai. Dekhte hai iss list mei sabka INDEX kya hai.
lists-operations_key11: Agar aap dhyaan se dekhenge toh aap samjhenge ki INDEX uss ITEM ki position se 1 kam hota hai, kyunki index ki ginti 0 se shuru hoti hai aur 1 se nahi.
lists-operations_key22: Kya last line se `error` aati hai? `Error` aayi -
lists-operations_key24: Iska matlab simple - jo INDEX aapne diya hai woh List ke `indices` (indices - index ka plural hai) ki range se baahar hai
lists-operations_key26: maximum INDEX hum kitna daal sakte hai?
lists-operations_key28: INDEX ki length se ek kam. Usse zyada daalne se `index out of range` `error` aayegi.
lists-operations_key29: `Error` ke baare mein google kar ke thoda aur samjho. Yeh `error` aapka peecha nahi chodegi ;) Behetar hai, abhi thoda samajh jayein!
lists-operations_key31: Issi tarah se hum LIST mei ITEMS ko update/change bhi kar sakte hai.
lists-operations_key32: Kya dekha aapne? Jo 0 INDEX par ITEM tha woh change ho kar "abhishek" ho gaya. Issi tarah se yeh `code` run karo.
lists-operations_key33: Jo 3 INDEX par ITEM tha woh change ho kar "rishabh" ho gaya. Dhyaan rakhe, ki INDEX item ki position se ek kam hota hai. Aise hi agar aap yeh likhoge:
lists-operations_key34: Aapko list index out of range `error` milegi, kyuki 5th index par koi ITEM exist nahi karti
lists-operations_key35: # Length of List and Adding values of the List
lists-operations_key36: Agar humne apne `code` mein ek list ki length dekhni hai, toh hum `len` function ka use kar sakte hain.
lists-operations_key37: Agar humne list mein ek nayi value daalni hai toh hum `append` function use kar ke daal sakte hain. `append` function ka use kar ke hum list ke aakhir mein ek nayi value daal sakte hain.
lists-operations_key38: Yahan dekho ki `append` function se pehle list ki length `5` thi aur uske baad `6` ho gayi. Jab appne `names_list` print kari toh dekho ki `dhruv` ki value last mein add ho gayi.
lists-operations_key39: Ek aur baar append kar ke dekhte hain.
lists-operations_key40: Issi tarah se aap kitne bhi elements add kar sakte hai
lists-operations_key42: Jaise hum list se elements add kar rahe the, waise hi elements remove bhi kar sakte hain.
lists-operations_key43: List se agar aakhiri element hatana ho toh uske liye `pop` function use karte hai.
lists-operations_key44: Print karke dekho ki aakhri element hatt gaya hoga. Firse ek aur element remove kar ke dekhte hain.
lists-operations_key45: Aap `list` par `pop` `function` kisi argument ke saath bhi call kar sakte hai. Yaani aap `pop` mei kuch `index` daal sakte hai, jaisa karne par, uss list se, uss index ka `element` remove ho jayega.
lists-operations_key47: # Check if Element exists in List
lists-operations_key48: List mei kaafi saari interesting operations kiye ja sakte hai. Unmei se ek operation hai yeh dekhna ki koi particular ITEM LIST mei belong karta hai ya nahi. Jaise:
lists-operations_key49: Iska result `True` aayega kyunki "shivam" `names_list` mein exist karta hai.
lists-operations_key50: Iska result `false` aayega kyunki "imtiyaz" `names_list` mein exist nahi karta.
lists-operations_key51: Kyunki yeh ek boolean value (`True`/`False`) return karta hai, hum isko If `statement` ke saath use kar sakte hain. Jaise:
lists-operations_key52: *Yaad kariye humne booleans ke baare mein last lessons mein kya pada tha.*
